Today we recognize the A&T Four and every American who joined the sit-in movement to protest the racism of the Jim Crow South, and eventually change public policy. This year's #BlackHistoryMonth theme is "Black Resistance," and the Greensboro Four exemplify that value.

Protests against injustice led to civil rights and voting rights for Black Americans, as well as equal protection of the law. We have a responsibility to learn from our past and work diligently to carry on the legacy of these four men by ensuring equal rights for all people.

On this day in 1960, four courageous Black students from NC A&T sat down at a whites-only lunch counter and asked to be served. In doing so, the Greensboro Four sparked the sit-in movement and changed the United States forever. #BlackHistoryMonth http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Fn4f2cgXEAMvrOQ.jpg

It's time to impeach.

Joe Biden has been derelict in his duty to respond to this national security crisis. Let's be very clear: he is president. It is because of his inaction that 1.2 million migrants have evaded law enforcement, entering our country illegally without a trace.

Instead, President Biden has fought to end Title 42, a policy that enables us to expedite the removal of illegal immigrants. Reports suggest that ending Title 42 would increase the surge at the border, yet it continues to be a priority for Joe Biden.

Despite the fact that nearly 3 out of every 10 migrants attempting to enter our country in FY22 evaded law enforcement, President Biden and Democrats in Congress have FAILED to meaningfully boost spending for border enforcement.

And let's be clear, the government is probably UNDERESTIMATING the number of gotaways, meaning it could be even higher...much higher. 

All told, under Joe Biden, there have been AT LEAST 1.2 million gotaways. This is greater than the population of at least nine states.

https://coronavirus.house.gov/news/reports/select-subcommittee-report-details-trump-administration-s-failure-prevent-fraud

https://oversightdemocrats.house.gov/legislation/hearings/follow-the-money-tackling-improper-payments

That same day, @COVIDoversight Dems released a report outlining how Trump’s refusal to implement basic controls in PPP and EIDL led to billions of dollars in potential fraud.
https://coronavirus.house.gov/news/reports/select-subcommittee-releases-new-findings-trump-administration-s-failure-prevent

Black History is American history.

This #BlackHistoryMonth we champion Black Resistance – African Americans' historic and ongoing efforts against oppression and work toward equality throughout our country. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Fn5_UuSXEA0TCXX.jpg

MAGA Republicans in Florida and beyond have attempted to rewrite history to censor Black stories. 

It’s more important than ever to ensure Black voices are heard, and to teach even grim chapters in our nation’s history.

From Dr. MLK Jr., Rosa Parks, and Rep. John Lewis to Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson, President Barack Obama, and VP Kamala Harris, Black leaders have shaped America. 

This month, we recommit to the pursuit of equal justice.
During #BlackHistoryMonth, we recognize the accomplishments of Black leaders, activists and changemakers throughout history, and celebrate the work of Black Americans to advance change and progress.

As we celebrate the start of #BlackHistoryMonth we recognize that the contributions of Black Americans can never be contained to one single month.

We must lift up & live by the lessons of their achievements each and everyday, and never forget: Black history is American history.

The Union Integrity Act provides strong whistleblower protections for union employees who want to reveal corrupt and illegal practices of union bosses. (5/5)

The Prohibit Neutrality Agreements Act empowers employers to:
✅ Contract with employees and labor organizations as they see fit
❌ Without being subject to coercive union tactics and smear campaigns.
(4/5)

The Repeal Davis-Bacon Act gets rid of the Jim Crow era “Davis-Bacon” law that:
❌ Requires the government to pay the “prevailing wage”
❌ Inflates the cost of taxpayer funded construction and infrastructure.
(3/5)
As Chairman of the Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions Subcommittee, I am committed to holding the Biden Administration accountable for its anti-business, anti-worker agenda. (2/5)

🚨I just renewed my commitment to boldly stand up to the union bosses and radical labor policies by introducing 3 pro-American worker bills:
➡️ the Repeal Davis-Bacon Act
➡️ the Prohibit Neutrality Agreements Act
➡️the Union Integrity Act.
(1/5)

Today Blackdom is a ghost town outside of Roswell, designated only by a historical marker on Highway 285.

Learn more from @NMPBS: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AZO0-8P6hso

Founded by Francis Boyer in the early 1900s, Blackdom grew to a population of 300, and included a post office, school, church, and office building.

The utopia Henderson described didn't last, however, and drought forced the homesteaders to relocate to nearby towns by the 1920s. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Fn6XdM9acAIg4Ye.jpg

“Here the black man has an equal chance with the white man. Here you are reckoned at the value which you place upon yourself," Lucy Henderson wrote to The Chicago Defender in 1912.

She was writing of her home in Blackdom – New Mexico’s first African American settlement. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Fn6XWAyaAAAPY3i.jpg

Black history is American history.

True equality requires us to both celebrate the rich contributions of Black Americans and to reflect on the racism and bigotry of our past and present.

So I'd like to highlight some of New Mexico’s own history this #BlackHistoryMonth. 👇

This was the beginning of a political tradition for Black Clevelanders that led to many firsts for the city + region, incl.:
-Carl Stokes, the first Black Mayor of a major American city (1968),
-Stephanie Tubbs Jones, the first Black woman elected to Congress from Ohio (1998).

The Black community in #OH11 grew after the Civil War, and segregation began to take root.
 
African Americans created their own resources, including electing public officials. In 1873, John Patterson Green became Cleveland's first African American politician.

A major stop on the Underground Railroad, Cleveland was code-named "Station Hope."
 
The newly released 2023 @usmint American Innovation Coin recognizes Ohio’s pivotal role in and on the Underground Railroad.
 
Learn more about the coin at https://www.usmint.gov/coins/coin-medal-programs/american-innovation-dollar-coins/ohio-underground-railroad.

Cleveland's African American community is almost as old as the city itself, with George Peake becoming the first permanent Black settler in 1809. 

As an inventor, he foreshadowed the ingenuity that has become synonymous with #OH11.

In August 2022, Sen. @ossoff personally led an economic delegation to the Republic of India to meet with key business and government leaders and continue urging for a reduction in tariffs.

Sen. @ossoff also met last year with Deputy U.S. Trade Representative Ambassador Sarah Bianchi, who agreed at his urging to put reducing India’s high pecan tariffs at the top of the U.S.-India trade agenda.

Sen. @ossoff met seven times with India’s Ambassador to the U.S Taranjit Singh Sandhu over the last year, and the two agreed to work together to make improvements to the U.S.-India trade relationship. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Fn6wmmfXkAE1lzu.jpg

Sen. @ossoff: "I thank U.S. Trade Representative @AmbassadorTai  for her steadfast support, Indian Ambassador Sandhu for his constructive engagement, @SenatorWarnock for his teamwork, and Georgia's farmers for their perseverance to secure this victory.”

At the request of Georgia farmers, Sen. @Ossoff has worked behind the scenes for months with U.S. trade negotiators and Indian government officials to open the Indian market for Georgia pecan growers.

https://pecanreport.com/news/georgia-senator-working-to-help-farmers/

BREAKING: Following Sen. @ossoff’s months-long push, India is cutting tariffs on U.S. pecan exports by 70%.

“This is a huge win for Georgia pecan farmers, and it wouldn’t be possible without them,” Sen. @ossoff said. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Fn6xSIRWIAEexd7.jpg
